Class CoopGameController

java.lang.Object
com.comp2042.controller.cooperateBattle.coopController.CoopGameController
public class CoopGameController extends Object
Controller coordinating the cooperative two-player game mode.

This class maintains a shared board matrix and two CoopPlayerState instances (left and right). It exposes operations used by the UI layer to move/rotate players, trigger drops, swaps and advance the game by one tick. The class is intentionally lightweight and delegates per-player logic to CoopPlayerState and tick merging/clearing logic to CoopTickHandler.

      public boolean rotateRightPlayer()

    • tick

      public CoopTickResult tick()
      Advance the game state by one tick. This attempts to move pieces down for both players, merges landed pieces into the board, checks for cleared rows and adjusts scores. When a merge occurs the method will spawn new pieces for the affected players.
      Returns:
      a CoopTickResult describing what happened this tick

    • onLeftDown

      public DownData onLeftDown()
      Handle an explicit soft-drop action for the left player.

      If the piece can move down this will translate the piece and award one point to the shared score. If the piece cannot move down it is merged into the board, row clears are processed and a new piece is spawned.

      Returns:
      DownData describing the result of the drop (landing view and any clear)

    • onRightDown

      public DownData onRightDown()
      Handle an explicit soft-drop action for the right player. Behavior mirrors onLeftDown() but for the right player.
      Returns:
      DownData describing the result of the drop

    • gameOverProperty

      public javafx.beans.property.BooleanProperty gameOverProperty()
      Property indicating whether the game is over (spawn collision detected).
      Returns:
      the gameOver property

    • swapLeft

      public boolean swapLeft()
      Swap the left player's current brick with their next brick (if available). If the swap would cause immediate collision the swap is undone and false is returned.
      Returns:
      true if the swap succeeded

    • swapRight

      public boolean swapRight()
      Swap the right player's current brick with their next brick (if available). If the swap would cause immediate collision the swap is undone and false is returned.
      Returns:
      true if the swap succeeded
